humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a gross tumor size of 6.0 cm in the modified mastectomy specimen, which is located in the upper-outer quadrant. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, and in this case, the tumor is larger than 5 cm, which corresponds to a T3 stage. This is consistent with the report's statement of 'GROSS TUMOR SIZE IS AT LEAST 6.0 CM' for the modified mastectomy specimen. The presence of lymphatic/vascular invasion, multifocal tumor, or lymph node involvement does not affect the T stage, so those factors can be ignored for this determination.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The tumor size in the pathologic report is described as 3.5 x 2.2 x 1.7 cm in the biopsy specimen (A) and at least 6.0 cm in the modified mastectomy specimen (B). The T stage is determined by the greatest dimension of the tumor. Therefore, the T stage is T2 (tumor size > 2 cm and ≤ 5 cm) based on the size described in the biopsy specimen.
